intro: Savia hildebrandtii, commonly known as the Hildebrandt's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
